verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to the rebellious <WH5637> children, <WH1121> said <WH5002> the LORD, <WH3068> that take <WH6213> counsel, <WH6098> but not of me; and that cover <WH5258> with a covering, <WH4541> but not of my spirit, <WH7307> that they may add <WH5595> sin <WH2403> to sin: <WH2403>

That walk <WH1980> to go <WH3381> down <WH3381> into Egypt, <WH4714> and have not asked <WH7592> at my mouth; <WH6310> to strengthen <WH5810> themselves in the strength <WH4581> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> and to trust <WH2620> in the shadow <WH6738> of Egypt! <WH4714>
Therefore shall the strength <WH4581> of Pharaoh <WH6547> be your shame, <WH1322> and the trust <WH2622> in the shadow <WH6738> of Egypt <WH4714> your confusion. <WH3639>
For his princes <WH8269> were at Zoan, <WH6814> and his ambassadors <WH4397> came <WH5060> to Hanes. <WH2609>

They were all <WH3605> ashamed <WH954> of a people <WH5971> that could not profit <WH3276> them, nor <WH3808> be an help <WH5828> nor <WH3808> profit, <WH3276> but a shame, <WH1322> and also <WH1571> a reproach. <WH2781>

The burden <WH4853> of the beasts <WH929> of the south: <WH5045> into the land <WH776> of trouble <WH6869> and anguish, <WH6695> from where <WH1992> come the young <WH3838> and old <WH3918> lion, <WH3918> the viper <WH660> and fiery <WH8314> flying <WH5774> serpent, <WH8314> they will carry <WH5375> their riches <WH2428> on the shoulders <WH3802> of young asses, <WH5895> and their treasures <WH214> on the bunches <WH1707> of camels, <WH1581> to a people <WH5971> that shall not profit <WH3276> them.

For the Egyptians <WH4714> shall help <WH5826> in vain, <WH1892> and to no <WH7385> purpose: <WH7385> therefore <WH3651> have I cried <WH7121> concerning this, <WH2063> Their strength <WH7293> is to sit <WH7674> still. <WH7673>

Now <WH6258> go, <WH935> write <WH3789> it before <WH854> them in a table, <WH3871> and note <WH2710> it in a book, <WH5612> that it may be for the time <WH3117> to come <WH314> for ever <WH5703> and ever: <WH5769>
That this <WH1931> is a rebellious <WH4805> people, <WH5971> lying <WH3586> children, <WH1121> children <WH1121> that will <WH14> not hear <WH8085> the law <WH8451> of the LORD: <WH3068>

Which <WH834> say <WH559> to the seers, <WH7200> See <WH7200> not; and to the prophets, <WH2374> Prophesy <WH2372> not to us right <WH5229> things, speak <WH1696> to us smooth <WH2513> things, prophesy <WH2372> deceits: <WH4123>
Get you out of the way, <WH1870> turn <WH5186> aside <WH5186> out of the path, <WH734> cause the Holy <WH6918> One of Israel <WH3478> to cease <WH7673> from before <WH6440> us.

Why <WH3651> thus <WH3541> said <WH559> the Holy <WH6918> One of Israel, <WH3478> Because <WH3282> you despise <WH3988> this <WH2088> word, <WH1697> and trust <WH982> in oppression <WH6233> and perverseness, <WH3868> and stay <WH8172> thereon: <WH5921>

Therefore <WH3651> this <WH2088> iniquity <WH5771> shall be to you as a breach <WH6556> ready to fall, <WH5307> swelling <WH1158> out in a high <WH7682> wall, <WH2346> whose <WH834> breaking <WH7667> comes <WH935> suddenly <WH6597> at an instant. <WH6621>

And he shall break <WH7665> it as the breaking <WH7667> of the potters' <WH3335> vessel <WH5035> that is broken <WH3807> in pieces; he shall not spare: <WH2550> so that there shall not be found <WH4672> in the bursting <WH4386> of it a shard <WH2789> to take <WH2846> fire <WH784> from the hearth, <WH3344> or to take <WH2834> water <WH4325> with out of the pit. <WH1360>

For thus <WH3541> said <WH559> the Lord <WH136> GOD, <WH3069> the Holy <WH6918> One of Israel; <WH3478> In returning <WH7729> and rest <WH5183> shall you be saved; <WH3467> in quietness <WH8252> and in confidence <WH985> shall be your strength: <WH1369> and you would <WH14> not.

But you said, <WH559> No; <WH3808> for we will flee <WH5127> on horses; <WH5483> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> shall you flee: <WH5127> and, We will ride <WH7392> on the swift; <WH7031> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> shall they that pursue <WH7291> you be swift. <WH7043>

One <WH259> thousand <WH505> shall flee at <WH6440> the rebuke <WH1606> of one; <WH259> at <WH6440> the rebuke <WH1606> of five <WH2568> shall you flee: <WH5127> till you be left <WH3498> as a beacon <WH8650> on the top <WH7218> of a mountain, <WH2022> and as an ensign <WH5251> on <WH5921> an hill. <WH1389>

And therefore <WH3651> will the LORD <WH3068> wait, <WH2442> that he may be gracious <WH2603> to you, and therefore <WH3651> will he be exalted, <WH7311> that he may have mercy <WH7355> on you: for the LORD <WH3068> is a God <WH430> of judgment: <WH4941> blessed <WH835> are all <WH3605> they that wait <WH2442> for him.

For the people <WH5971> shall dwell <WH3427> in Zion <WH6726> at Jerusalem: <WH3389> you shall weep <WH1058> no <WH3808> more: <WH1058> he will be very gracious <WH2603> to you at the voice <WH6963> of your cry; <WH2201> when he shall hear <WH8085> it, he will answer <WH6030> you.

And though the Lord <WH136> give <WH5414> you the bread <WH3899> of adversity, <WH6862> and the water <WH4325> of affliction, <WH3905> yet shall not your teachers <WH3384> be removed <WH3670> into a corner <WH3671> any more, <WH5750> but your eyes <WH5869> shall see <WH7200> your teachers: <WH3384>

And your ears <WH241> shall hear <WH8085> a word <WH1697> behind <WH310> you, saying, <WH559> This <WH2088> is the way, <WH1870> walk <WH3212> you in it, when <WH3588> you turn to the right <WH541> hand, and when <WH3588> you turn to the left. <WH8041>

You shall defile <WH2930> also the covering <WH6826> of your graven <WH6456> images of silver, <WH3701> and the ornament <WH642> of your molten <WH4541> images of gold: <WH2091> you shall cast <WH2219> them away <WH2219> as a menstruous <WH1739> cloth; <WH4346> you shall say <WH559> to it, Get <WH3318> you hence. <WH3318>

Then shall he give <WH5414> the rain <WH4306> of your seed, <WH2233> that you shall sow <WH2232> the ground <WH127> with; and bread <WH3899> of the increase <WH8393> of the earth, <WH127> and it shall be fat <WH1879> and plenteous: <WH8082> in that day <WH3117> shall your cattle <WH4735> feed <WH7462> in large <WH7337> pastures. <WH3733>

The oxen <WH504> likewise and the young asses <WH5895> that ear <WH5647> the ground <WH127> shall eat <WH398> clean <WH2548> provender, <WH1098> which <WH834> has been winnowed <WH2219> with the shovel <WH7371> and with the fan. <WH4214>

And there shall be on every <WH3605> high <WH1364> mountain, <WH2022> and on every <WH3605> high <WH4791> hill, <WH1389> rivers <WH6388> and streams <WH2988> of waters <WH4325> in the day <WH3117> of the great <WH7227> slaughter, <WH2027> when the towers <WH4026> fall. <WH5307>

Moreover the light <WH216> of the moon <WH3842> shall be as the light <WH216> of the sun, <WH2535> and the light <WH216> of the sun <WH8121> shall be sevenfold, <WH7659> as the light <WH216> of seven <WH7651> days, <WH3117> in the day <WH3117> that the LORD <WH3068> binds <WH2280> up the breach <WH7667> of his people, <WH5971> and heals <WH7495> the stroke <WH4273> of their wound. <WH4347>

Behold, <WH2009> the name <WH8034> of the LORD <WH3068> comes <WH935> from far, <WH4801> burning <WH1197> with his anger, <WH639> and the burden <WH4858> thereof is heavy: <WH3514> his lips <WH8193> are full <WH4390> of indignation, <WH2195> and his tongue <WH3956> as a devouring <WH398> fire: <WH784>

And his breath, <WH7307> as an overflowing <WH7857> stream, <WH5158> shall reach <WH2673> to the middle <WH2673> of the neck, <WH6677> to sift <WH5130> the nations <WH1471> with the sieve <WH5299> of vanity: <WH7723> and there shall be a bridle <WH7448> in the jaws <WH3895> of the people, <WH5971> causing them to err. <WH8582>

You shall have <WH1961> a song, <WH7892> as in the night <WH3915> when a holy <WH6942> solemnity <WH2282> is kept; <WH6942> and gladness <WH8057> of heart, <WH3824> as when one goes <WH1980> with a pipe <WH2485> to come <WH935> into the mountain <WH2022> of the LORD, <WH3068> to the mighty <WH6697> One of Israel. <WH3478>

And the LORD <WH3068> shall cause his glorious <WH1935> voice <WH6963> to be heard, <WH8085> and shall show <WH7200> the lighting <WH5183> down <WH5183> of his arm, <WH2220> with the indignation <WH2197> of his anger, <WH639> and with the flame <WH3851> of a devouring <WH398> fire, <WH784> with scattering, <WH5311> and tempest, <WH2230> and hailstones <WH68> <WH1259>.
For through the voice <WH6963> of the LORD <WH3068> shall the Assyrian <WH804> be beaten <WH2865> down, which smote <WH5221> with a rod. <WH7626>

And in every <WH3605> place where the grounded <WH4145> staff <WH4294> shall pass, <WH4569> which <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> shall lay <WH5117> on him, it shall be with tabrets <WH8596> and harps: <WH3658> and in battles <WH4421> of shaking <WH8573> will he fight <WH3898> with it.

For Tophet <WH8613> is ordained <WH6186> of old; <WH865> yes, <WH1571> for the king <WH4428> it is prepared; <WH3559> he has made it deep <WH6009> and large: <WH7337> the pile <WH4071> thereof is fire <WH784> and much <WH7235> wood; <WH6086> the breath <WH5397> of the LORD, <WH3068> like a stream <WH5158> of brimstone, <WH1614> does kindle <WH1197> it.
